reviews.review_msg: she's tough but very fair. is helpful when you need her help. if you follow the guidelines set out by the professor and do everything you're supposed to with a decent amount of effort. as long as you speak at least twice every class, you will get full participation marks. it's possible to participate w/o reading assigned readings.

Everything mentioned in the final exam review class is on the exam. With a written take home midterm, term paper, presentation, and final, was a lot of work for little payoff (20% per component). Presentation and participation were too highly weighted IMO. Grade (except for final) depends on TA. Wish there was more overlap of lecture and readings.
Lecture notes are posted online, but there is still a LOT of note taking. Marking and exams are fair. Lectures can be rather boring though.

It's fine... Depends on the TA but I would complain that the modules are hard to navigate and incomplete.
Turnaround for marking isn't fast but isn't absurdly slow. There is lots of annotation returned to you. Marking is very very nitpicky. 
Sometimes the lecture recording and module instructions differ.

The online design of this class is fine, and the workload is manageable. The course is what you expect for a required upper-div course on theory. BUT Dr. Faubert herself is very difficult to communicate with. She lives in another province so email is the only way, and she is not good at it. She's short, dismissive, and disinterested. AVOID her.
not a fair marker at all! super boring too.

I honestly expected this course to be super difficult but Jacqueline made it as easy as possible. If you follow the guidelines and do basically everything thats required with some effort, achieving a B or anything higher is easily doable! Jacqueline is easily the best prof for online courses, also had her for 321 online. 10/10 would recommend!

Tough, but fair. Class consists of weekly Canvas discussions (10%), a 2 - 3 page presentation (5%), two BBC discussions (10%), and three 8 - 10 page papers (75%). Expects a lot from students, but gives excellent feedback on the papers to help you improve each time. Not overly writing intensive compared to what others make it seem. Highly recommend
